Education.Institution Name: Binghamton University, State University of New York
Education.Degree: Masters of Science : Industrial and Systems Engineering

Experience.Description: Undertook a leadership and advisory role in training newcomers to hone their culinary and behavioral skills.

Identified the areas in the assembly line of a light commercial vehicle where more operations could be housed. Developed a detailed model of improved layout to accommodate more operations using AutoCAD to improve the space utilization by 300%.

Consulted a self-storage company to classify the customers as 'worthy' and 'not worthy' based on their activity on the company website using the Random Forest algorithm. Built the model in R and model deployment using Python. Currently building a reservation model for Public Storage to forecast if the customer would reserve the storage or not.

Projects.Project Name: Classification of Customers for Credit Card Company
Projects.Description: Performed a logistic regression on a credit card company dataset to classify clients as credible and non-credible. Extracted crucial factors to simplify the classification model using exploratory factor analysis. Developed and validated a model to classify the future customers and aid decision-making.

Projects.Project Name: Simulation Analysis of Adding a Second Parking Ticket Booth at a Mall
Projects.Description: Assessed distribution and trends of incoming customer patterns performing statistical analysis on MATLAB and ExpertFit. Additional booth modeled using Arena reduced average waiting time per customer from 6.2 minutes to 1.8 minutes.

Projects.Project Name: Statistical Analysis of Defects in Clutch Plate Manufacturing - A Six Sigma Study
Projects.Description: The DMAIC methodology (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and Control) was implemented to understand the cause of the defects and data was statistically analyzed with the help of control charts using Minitab.
